story.storykicker: The win takes BJP's tally to 166 in the 230 member MP assembly.
story.storybody:
BJP candidate Mangal Singh defeated Congress' Pratap Singh Uike on Thursday to help the party retain the Ghodadongri (ST) assembly seat in Madhya Pradesh.

Singh defeated Uike by a margin of 13,182 votes in the bypoll conducted after the seat fell vacant due BJP MLA Sajjan Singh Uike's death in March this year. Voting was held on May 30 and counting was held at the district headquarters at Betul on Thursday.

The win takes BJP's tally to 166 in the 230 member MP assembly. Collector, Betul Gyaneshwar Patil declared Singh's win after 17 rounds of counting. Singh secured 82,304 votes while Uike secured 69,122 votes.

The vote-share shows an improvement in the BJP's performance. In 2013, Sajjan Singh Uike had defeated Congress' Brahma Bhalavi by a margin of 8084 votes on the same seat.

The bypoll was being perceived as a test of CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan's popularity among the tribal electorate in the state. The BJP had in November, 2015 lost the Ratlam (ST) Lok Sabha seat to the Congress in a by poll.
story.magazinekicker: The win takes BJP's tally to 166 in the 230 member MP assembly.
